title: New drought package on the way as pressure builds
text:
"It's about how and when to add to it, that's the decision,'' said a source.

Discussion on new measures began after Treasurer Josh Frydenberg conducted a drought tour in late September.

"The Treasurer doesn't go on a drought tour and then do nothing about it,'' said the source.

The government currently has drought assistance measures totalling $7 billion, although $5 billion of this is a drought future fund which, from July 1, will start handing out $100 million a year for drought-resilience projects.

The issue is starting to bite politically in urban areas as well and is exacerbating tensions between the Nationals and the Liberals with the former feeling they are being sidelined by Mr Morrison.

The Nationals have released their own drought plan which requires $1.3 billion in extra assistance, but it is understood the government's measures will not go this far.

Mr Joyce says the next election will hinge on the response.

"If this drought keeps going, you've got to go ahead with extra funding, otherwise you just won't be in government," he said.

"I know the cabinet is coming forward with a package in the coming week. "

Mr Barilaro, who harbours ambitions to enter federal politics, called on the government to reconsider its opposition to boosting Newstart payments.

"My message to federal colleagues is we need to have a look at this, we need to make sure people can survive,'' he said.

"The Newstart allowance right now during this drought would be an easy way to stimulate rural and regional communities by supporting our kids or our young people in a way that we've never done before."

This was backed by Cassandra Goldie, the chief executive of the Australian Council for Social Services.

"Regional communities would see their economies lifted by millions overnight through a Newstart increase,'' she said.

"Deloitte Access Economics found that a $75 per week increase would greatly benefit regional Australia, not only because there is a disproportionate number of people in the regions on allowances due to fewer job opportunities, but also because people would spend the bulk of their income locally, buying local produce and services."
description: New drought assistance measures will be rolled out before the release of the mid-year budget update in December.
